text: . @AGJeffLandry has entered the fray over revenue forecasting and the governor's budget proposal, saying @LouisianaGov violated the constitution by submitting a budget recommendation that includes more money than is in the official forecast. #lalege #lagov

text: No. This is the chairman of the party, not the executive director.

text: . @LaAgandForestry and LSU's #medicalmarijuana grower have broken through a regulatory logjam, and the grower can now move into its full production facility. That moves Louisiana one big step closer to having medical marijuana available to patients. #lalege #lagov

text: . @CameronHenryLA says the governor didn't file an executive budget proposal this year. @LouisianaGov filed a wish list of sorts, with what money economists recommend -- even though the money isn't included in the official revenue forecast. #lalege #lagov
author: MelindaDeslatte

text:
Appropriations Chairman @CameronHenryLA says his budget bill (filed as HB105) will be the document used to craft next year's spending plans, rather than the traditional HB1 (which typically contains the governor's proposal). 
https://www.facebook.com/CameronHenryLA/videos/vb.304822189568306/421207468426832/?type=2&theater … #lalege #lagov

text:
This year's @GridironShowBR is happening Friday and Saturday! Tickets are still available to watch great Louisiana political satire and raise money for journalism student scholarships and public broadcasting. More info here: http://gridironshowbr.org/  
#lalege #lagov #laed
author: MelindaDeslatte

text:
Rep. Steven Pylant proposing to do away with the classified employees in the state civil service system for any new hires. Classified employees aren't political appointees and have more protections from hiring and firing. #lalege #lagov 
http://www.legis.la.gov/legis/ViewDocument.aspx?d=1116416 …
author: MelindaDeslatte

text: Competing budget bills have been pre-filed for the legislative session, one by Appropriations Chairman @CameronHenryLA: http://www.legis.la.gov/legis/ViewDocument.aspx?d=1116772 … and the proposal by @LouisianaGov filed by Rep. @WaltLeger: http://www.legis.la.gov/legis/ViewDocument.aspx?d=1116781 … #lalege #lagov
author: MelindaDeslatte

text: The task force is recommending that legislative leaders adopt a policy for handling sexual harassment complaints by third parties at the Capitol doing business with the Legislature (i.e. lobbyists, reporters, contractors, the public). #lalege #lagov
author: MelindaDeslatte

text: Special Legislative Task Force on the Prevention of Sexual Harassment is meeting today to get an update on efforts to enact new anti-harassment policies at the Capitol. #lalege #lagov
author: MelindaDeslatte

text: The four projects that will share in the money are the I-10 widening work in Baton Rouge, a new I-20 access for Barksdale Air Force Base, an I-10 interchange planned for the New Orleans airport and the LA23 Belle Chasse bridge and tunnel replacement project. #lalege #lagov
author: MelindaDeslatte

text: The Bond Commission approved the borrowing plan this morning. Bond sale scheduled for April. Will be the first of multiple bond sales for the projects. #lalege #lagov
author: MelindaDeslatte

text: Louisiana borrowing $185M in April to start interstate projects (from @AP) #lalege #lagov
author: MelindaDeslatte

text: Asked about the possibility of a gas tax proposal passing this session, @LouisianaGov responds: "Typically big things, controversial things, particularly around revenue, don’t happen in an election year." #lalege #lagov
author: MelindaDeslatte

text: Caller asks about legalization of industrial hemp production in Louisiana. @LouisianaGov says federal Farm Bill authorized this, subject to state regulation. He says he expects several bills on the subject for the regular session. #lalege #lagov
author: MelindaDeslatte

text: Under contract extension approved today, @Coach_EdOrgeron will make at least $4M annually (plus possible incentives). #lalege #lagov
author: MelindaDeslatte

text: . @LouisianaGov says he's happy that LSU board approved salary increase for football @Coach_EdOrgeron. Edwards says in comparison to what some coaches are paid in other states, "Coach Orgeron's a bargain." #lalege #lagov

text: . @LouisianaGov credits Medicaid expansion with helping rural hospitals, notes that Louisiana hasn't had any rural hospital closures unlike some other Southern states. #lalege #lagov

text: Asked by a caller about state-financed portion of Medicaid expansion, @LouisianaGov explains that lawmakers have passed financing tools to cover it, won't cost the state general fund. #lalege #lagov
author: MelindaDeslatte

text: Asked about former Regents chairman Richard Lipsey calling for firing of #LSU President F. King Alexander and athletic director Joe Alleva, @LouisianaGov says: "I'm not prepared to echo what he is saying in terms of the current leadership at LSU." #lalege #lagov
author: MelindaDeslatte

text: . @LouisianaGov monthly radio show is underway. #lalege #lagov
author: MelindaDeslatte

text: Lawmakers will consider the $19M higher education proposal in the upcoming regular session -- but the state can only afford the items if House Speaker Taylor Barras allows an increase in the state revenue forecast for this year. #lalege #lagov
author: MelindaDeslatte

text: The $19M for higher ed would fill gaps in the TOPS program, give money to schools facing accreditation reviews and pay for additional online resources for students. #lalege #lagov
author: MelindaDeslatte

text: Edwards proposing $19M more in spending for Louisiana higher education this budget year (from @AP) #lalege #lagov
